block.p: Martha Anneke DeJong, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bastiaan C. DeJong of Chatham, Mass., was married there yesterday to James Paul Volcker, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Volcker of New York. The Rev. Charles Amstein, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at the First Congregational Church.

Mrs. Volcker graduated from Wheaton College and is a candidate for an M.B.A. at Emory University. Her father, now retired, was a vice president of Anglo Nordic Shipping Ltd., a former shipping company in New York.

Martha Anneke DeJong, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bastiaan C. DeJong of Chatham, Mass., was married there yesterday to James Paul Volcker, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Volcker of New York. The Rev. Charles Amstein, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at the First Congregational Church.

Mrs. Volcker graduated from Wheaton College and is a candidate for an M.B.A. at Emory University. Her father, now retired, was a vice president of Anglo Nordic Shipping Ltd., a former shipping company in New York.

Mr. Volcker is research assistant in Jersey City with the economics department of the National Westminster Bancorp. He graduated from New York University. His father, a former chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, is the chairman of James D. Wolfensohn Inc., an investment banking concern in New York.
